qas.question: How much was the average cost of hospital stays for asthma-related issues for children??
How much was the average cost of hospital stays for asthma-related issues for adults?
Who was the most frequent primary payer amount children and adults?
Who was more likely to seek hospital help in the US for asthma reasons?
What was the average cost per hospital stay for high income communites in 2010?
How much did the cost increase for a child to be hospitalized for asthma in 2000?
Who was the primary payer for low income communities from 2000 to 2010?
What group with adults 18-44 had higher stays in the hospital in 2000 instead of higher income communities?
What group was covered by private insurance  in 2000?

context: From 2000 to 2010, the average cost per asthma-related hospital stay in the United States for children remained relatively stable at <a0_0><b4_0>about $3,600<b4_0/><a0_0/>, whereas the average cost per asthma-related hospital stay for adults increased <a1_0><b5_0>from $5,200 to $6,600<b5_0/><a1_0/>. In 2010, <a2_0><b6_0>Medicaid<b6_0/><a2_0/> was the most frequent primary payer among <b8_0>children and adults aged 18–44 years<b8_0/> in the United States; private insurance was the second most frequent payer. Among both children and adults in <a3_0><b7_0>the lowest income communities<b7_0/><a3_0/> in the United States there is a higher rates of hospital stays for asthma in 2010 than those in the highest income communities.
